articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: India has summoned the top Pakistani diplomat in New Delhi, local media reported on Thursday, a day after it announced measures to downgrade ties with Islamabad as relations between the nuclear-armed rivals plummeted following a deadly militant attack in Kashmir.
articles.title: India calls all-party meet, summons top Pakistani diplomat after Kashmir attack on tourists

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Korea expressed deep concern" over China erecting a sea structure off the west coast of the Korean Peninsula during a maritime dialogue with Beijing in Seoul on Wednesday, Seoul's Foreign Ministry said.
articles.title: South Korea expressed concern over Chinese structure in disputed area of sea

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An overnight Russian combined missile and drone attack triggered fires, smashed buildings and buried residents under rubble in the Ukrainian capital Kyiv, killing nine people and injuring more than 70, the State Emergency Service said on Thursday.
articles.title: Drone, missile attack on Kyiv kills nine, injures more than 70, says State Emergency Service

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Korean prosecutors have indicted former president Moon Jae-in for alleged bribery, a prosecution office spokesperson said on Thursday.
articles.title: South Korea prosecutors indict ex-president Moon Jae-in for bribery

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Dawoud Abu Alkas
articles.description: An Israeli airstrike on a school sheltering displaced families in northern Gaza killed at least 10 people, while another hit a children's hospital, local health authorities said, taking Wednesday's death toll to 20.
articles.title: Israeli airstrikes kill 10 in school housing displaced families, hit children's hospital, medics say

articles.author: Elizabeth Piper, Daphne Psaledakis, John Irish
articles.description: U.S., Ukrainian and European officials meet in London on Wednesday about ending Russia's war in Ukraine after warnings by U.S. President Donald Trump that Washington could walk away if there is no progress on a deal soon.
articles.title: Ukraine, Western countries meet on Russia war as diplomats say breakthrough unlikely

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Taiwan's premier on Thursday proposed another $10 billion in spending as a special budget to help the economy deal with the impact of U.S. tariffs.
articles.title: Taiwan proposes another $10 bln in aid to deal with US tariffs

articles.author: Christine Chen
articles.description: Australia will hold an election on May 3, and energy security has become a key issue as voters face rising power bills and the prospect of gas shortages.
articles.title: Australia Election: Where do the political parties stand on energy policy?

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China and Kenya announced they had upgraded ties to a "new level" on Thursday during a meeting between President Xi Jinping and Kenyan President William Ruto in Beijing, as they both pledged to create an "all weather" China-Africa community.
articles.title: China, Kenya upgrade ties amid 'turbulent international situation'

articles.author: Alvise Armellini
articles.description: Pope Francis' body will be moved to St Peter's Basilica on Wednesday to allow Catholic faithful to pay their final respects ahead of a funeral expected to bring U.S. President Donald Trump and dozens of other world leaders to Rome.
articles.title: Pope Francis' body lies in state at St Peter's ahead of funeral
